title: Know if your vehicle is blacklisted
byline: The Department of Motor Traffic (DMT) and the Vehicular Emission Test Trust Fund (VETTF) have introduced a web portal that enables vehicle owners to check whether their vehicles have been blacklisted a service designed to improve transparency and enforce emission regulations.

title: Trump delays tariffs on 14 countries until August
byline: President Donald Trump says he has delayed imposing higher tariffs on goods entering the US from 14 countries, including Japan and South Korea.

title: Johan Peiris returns after conquering seven summits
byline: Renowned Sri Lankan mountaineer Johan Peiris, who successfully climbed the highest peaks on all seven continents, arrived at Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) this morning after conquering his final summit, Mount Denali in Alaska, North America.

title: Tusker Bhathiya critical
byline: A team of wildlife conservators grappling to save the life of the tusker in Maho wildlife zone popularly known as “Bhathiya” said the jumbo was in a precarious condition.

title: Underworld crimes continue to rock govt.
byline: Sri Lanka’s law enforcement authorities have intensified large-scale joint search operations across the country in response to a sharp rise in drug trafficking, underworld violence and gun-related crimes, the Daily Mirror learns.

title: Cement demand climbs to 4.7mn MT
byline: But industry faces headwinds, says Tokyo Cement

title: NTC pushes digital shift with transit cards, Google Maps despite audit heat
byline: The National Transport Commission (NTC) is advancing its plans to modernise Sri Lanka’s public transport system by introducing a prepaid transit card and integrating bus routes into Google Maps.

title: Potential Trump tariffs could trigger 50,000 job losses initially, warns FTZMA
byline: Sri Lanka’s economy is bracing for a potential shockwave, as the Free Trade Zone Manufacturers Association (FTZMA) warns that the proposed tariffs by President Donald Trump could lead to a loss of approximately 50,000 jobs in the initial stages and render the nation uncompetitive in the South and Southeast Asian region.

title: Sri Lanka faces shortage of police officers: Minister
byline: Sri Lanka is currently facing a shortage of police officers, Minister of Public Security Ananda Wijepala told Parliament today.

title: Abdul Wazeeth sworn in as MP
byline: Abdul Wazeeth was sworn in as a Member of Parliament before Speaker Jagath Wickramaratne a short while ago.

title: Presidential Secretariat declines to disclose names of media division officials under RTI
byline: The Presidential Secretariat has informed social activist Anuruddha Bandara that the names of officials attached to the Presidential Media Division cannot be disclosed.

title: Mulder reveals reasons why he left Lara's record untouched
byline: South Africa’s Wiaan Mulder said it is ’’exactly the way it should be’’ for Brian Lara to hold on to his record for the highest individual score in a Test innings.

title: Right to Information laws are crucial for combating corruption - CA
byline: In another judgment broadening the scope of the applicability of the Right to Information Act, the Court of Appeal recently held that, in the modern era, Right to Information laws are crucial for combating corruption by increasing transparency and accountability within public institutions.

title: Trump delays tariffs on 14 countries until August
byline: President Donald Trump says he has delayed imposing higher tariffs on goods entering the US from 14 countries, including Japan and South Korea.

title: China extends visa-free entry to over 70 countries to draw tourists
byline: Foreign tourists are trickling back to China after the country loosened its visa policy to unprecedented levels.

title: Dr. Maheshi Wijerathna further remanded over corruption charges
byline: The specialist neurosurgeon Dr. Maheshi Wijerathna, attached to the Sri Jayewardenepura General Hospital, was today ordered to be further remanded until July 15 by Colombo Chief Magistrate Thanuja Lakmali Jayathunga over allegations of corruption.

title: No improvement in Bathiya’s health; new treatment decision tomorrow
byline: A decision is expected tomorrow on whether to change the treatment being given to the ailing elephant Bathiya, who has been ill for several days in the Polpithigama area.

title: Report on container clearance scam to be presented to Parliament soon
byline: The report of the committee that investigated into the container clearance scam will be presented to Parliament soon, Deputy Minister Anil Jayantha told the House today.

title: National media policy to be introduced within three months: Minister
byline: The national media policy will come into effect within three months, Minister of Mass Media Nalinda Jayatissa told Parliament today.

title: First malaria treatment for babies approved for use
byline: The first malaria treatment suitable for babies and very young children has been approved for use.

title: Eight Sri Lankans set to feature in ILT20 Season 4
byline: Eight Sri Lankan cricketers are set to take part in the fourth season of the International League T20 (ILT20), scheduled to be held from December 2025 to January 2026.

title: New Commissioner General of Excise to be appointed
byline: M.B.N.A. Premarathne, a retired Commodore of the Sri Lanka Navy, is to be appointed as the new Commissioner General of Excise.

title: Nearly 1,000 to be sued over mosquito breeding places
byline: Legal action is to be initiated against 982 individuals following a nationwide mosquito control campaign carried out by the Ministry of Health from June 30 to July 5.

title: Cabinet approves  allowance for religious school teachers
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has approved a proposal to provide an annual allowance of Rs. 7,500 to teachers serving in registered religious schools, starting in 2026.

title: Sri Lanka, Canada to tackle cross-border crime
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has approved a proposal to enter into a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) between the Sri Lanka Police and the Royal Canadian Mounted Police (RCMP).

title: Cabinet approves Sri Lanka Navy to conduct maritime security operations
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval for the Sri Lanka Navy to independently conduct maritime security operations under the supervision of the Ministry of Defence.

title: Parcel with mobile phones thrown into Boossa Prison premises
byline: Boossa Prison authorities recovered a parcel containing eight mobile phones that had been thrown into the prison premises early this morning.

title: Government to introduce Property Tax by mid-2027
byline: Sri Lanka plans to introduce a property tax by the first half of 2027, according to the latest International Monetary Fund (IMF) review under the Extended Fund Facility (EFF).

title: Former Health Secretary granted bail
byline: Former Health Ministry Secretary Janaka Sri Chandragupta was released on bail in connection with an ongoing investigation into the alleged accumulation of illicit assets.

title: Former Deputy Commissioner General of Motor Traffic Department granted bail
byline: The former Commissioner General of the Motor Traffic Department, Nishantha Anuruddha Weerasinghe and three others were released on bail over an illegal vehicle registration and number plate fraud case involving the failure to deregister vehicles from Sri Lanka Customs.
